title: Digital-Based Learning (DBL) Preference Analysis and Language Learning Application Study

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Proficiency and Understanding of Fundamental Language Learning Concepts
context.additional_context: A research-based curriculum comparing preferences and effectiveness of DBL (Digital-Based Learning) and traditional learning methods among language learners in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify their preferences by comparing the strengths and weaknesses of DBL and paper-based learning (PBL) with over 80% accuracy
Learners can derive at least three influencing factors on language learning outcomes by analyzing survey data
Learners can write a report explaining the correlation between digital tool usage time management and learning concentration levels

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
